title.narrative: Country Programme for inclusive and sustainable development of The Gambia 2021-2025

description.narrative:
This Country Programme (CP) is designed to enhance UNIDO’s support to the Government of The Gambia to implement a roadmap towards Inclusive and Sustainable Industrial Development (ISID). In doing this, UNIDO has aligned the priorities of its new programme of intervention to The Gambia “Vision 2020” (long-term Vision), the National Development Plan (2018-2021), as well as the United Nations Development Assistance Framework (UNDAF) for the period 2017-2021, building on the achievements of the former country programme and individual projects. Since it is based on established national priorities, the CP will be a practical guide for UNIDO’s interventions in The Gambia over the next 5-year period.
The UNIDO Country Programme (CP) for The Gambia will support the implementation of The Gambia National Development Plan 2018-2021, and notably, the Strategic Priorities 2, 3, 4, 5, 7 and 8 thereof. More specifically, with the initiatives implemented within the CP framework, UNIDO will contribute to the following key results and targets established by the Plan: • Value chains enhanced for Agriculture and Livestock Transformation - Increase Vegetable production from 34 (000’ Mt) to 50 (000’ Mt) • Increased production of basic agricultural commodities (crops and livestock) for enhanced food and nutrition security - Increase onion production from 6 (000’ Mt) to 19 (000’ Mt) • Enhanced institutional efficiency and effectiveness for the fisheries sector - Increase fisheries as a percentage of GDP from 6.4% to 15% • Improved policy and regulatory frameworks for sustainable energy and infrastructure - Availability of national energy and petroleum policy • Improved access to electricity and enhanced household energy security for sustainable economic development - Increase share of renewable energy in total electricity generation from 2% to 40%, Increase % of population with access to electricity from 40% to 60%, Increase electricity installed capacity from 102 to 250 MW, Reduce % of electricity losses from 25% to 17% • Gainful employment opportunities created, and entrepreneurial skills developed for Gambian youth - Reduced youth unemployment (15-35yrs) from 35.3% to 25% • Promoted and facilitated trade, investment, and private sector development - Increase total exports as a percentage of GDP from 9.4 %(2015) to 17%, Increase Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) as a percentage of GDP from 2.4% (2014) to 5% • MSME and industrial growth enhanced - Increase the MSME contribution to GDP from 20% to 30%, Increase the manufacturing contribution to GDP from 5% (2016) to 7%
The Programme will cover the following components, that have been agreed to by the GoTG, represented by the Ministry of Trade, Industry, Regional Integration and Employment (MOTIE) as the Chair of the CP Steering Committee (SC): • Component 1: Value chains and agro-industry development support (agriculture, fishery and the wider blue economy, livestock) • Component 2: Strengthening national quality infrastructure, modernization and upgrading of enterprises • Component 3: Supporting MSMEs, entrepreneurship development towards Industry 4.0 and the integration of youth and women in productive activities • Component 4: Promoting green industrialization: renewable energy, energy efficiency, cleaner production and waste management • Component 5: Support the development of industrial/technology parks/processing zones as well as industrial structuring projects
